Primary Contact: Kara Cooper, Coordinator of Adult Day Services & Volunteers; Phone: 250.980.1560; Email: kara.cooper@interiorhealth.ca
Volunteer Coordinator: Katie Durk, Activity/Volunteer Coordinator, Interior Health; Phone: 250.980.1558
Service Details: Offers supportive community programs for people at risk of losing their independence.  Services are designed to help  individuals to remain at home while supporting caregivers by providing a range of health, personal, social and recreational services in a safe and caring environment. While there are some variation in the services provided in Adult Day Services across Interior Health depending upon location, some examples include: - Health care such as health monitoring and giving medications- Assistance with personal care such as bathing programs- Health education- Therapeutic social programs and recreational programs such as discussion and exercise groups
Dates: Monday to Saturday depending on the site.
Eligibility: Ages: 19 year(s) and up- Have lived in British Columbia for three months - Be a Canadian citizen or have permanent resident status (be a landed immigrant or are on a Minister’s permit approved by the Ministry of Health Services) - Be unable to function independently because of chronic, health-related problems or have been diagnosed by a doctor with an end-stage illness
Cost: Program ; A user fee of up to $10.00 per day will be charged to cover costs for supplies and meals.
